com.flyingspaniel.nava.callback

Interface Callback<IN,OUT>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Callback.ProducesMore<IN,OUT,MORE>, Callback.ProducesMultiple<IN,OUT>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCallback, AbstractCallback.Canned, AbstractCallback.NOP

    public interface Callback<IN,OUT>
    Interface for a javascript/node.js like callback (and chain) Warning: The generics are mainly for documentation and decoration. Internally there are unchecked casts and if you screw up you will get ClassCastExceptions Also, currently there is limited support for more...
    Since:
    Copyright(c) 2013 Morgan Conrad
    Author:
    Morgan Conrad
    See Also:
    This software is released under the MIT License

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Callback.ProducesMore<IN,OUT,MORE>
      Implement this (rare) if your callback produces "more" than a single output This will be used by a single followup callback as its more...
      static interface  Callback.ProducesMultiple<IN,OUT>
      Implement this if your callback produces multiple single outputs to be used by multiple followup callbacks as their IN argument.

    • Method Detail

      • callback

        OUT callback(Exception ex,
           IN in,
           Object... more)
             throws Exception
        The callback method
        Parameters:
        ex - null, or an Exception thrown from an earlier callback. You should test for this!
        in - input data, probably coming from a previous callback
        more - additional input data (rarely used)
        Returns:
        result of processing
        Throws:
        Exception

      • setNextCallback

        void setNextCallback(Callback nextCallback)
        Set the callback to follow this one.
        Parameters:
        nextCallback - null means end of the line

      • getNextCallback

        Callback getNextCallback()
        Get the callback to follow this one.
        Returns:
        null means end of the line
